meanings.definition: The frequency at which a charged particle gyrates in a magnetic field.
meanings.sent1: The gyrofrequency of the electron determines its behavior in the magnetic field.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the gyrofrequency of particles to understand their movement in magnets.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous electron decided to dance to the beat of its gyrofrequency in the magnetic field.
meanings.sent4: The gyrofrequency of the charged particle hummed like a well-tuned engine in the magnetic field.
meanings.sent5: Visualizing the gyrofrequency is like watching a tiny dancer twirl gracefully in a magnetic ballet.

meanings.definition: The rate at which a particle completes a full rotation in a magnetic field.
meanings.sent1: Understanding the gyrofrequency helps predict the particle's path in the magnetic field.
meanings.sent2: The gyrofrequency of the proton determines its stability in the magnetic environment.
meanings.sent3: The particle's gyrofrequency seemed to play hide-and-seek with the magnetic field.
meanings.sent4: The gyrofrequency of the rotating particle echoed through the magnetic space like a cosmic clock.
meanings.sent5: The gyrofrequency is the rhythmic heartbeat of the particle's magnetic dance.

meanings.definition: The frequency of rotation of a charged particle in a magnetic field.
meanings.sent1: The gyrofrequency of the ion dictates its movement within the magnetic field.
meanings.sent2: Measuring the gyrofrequency helps determine the particle's magnetic behavior.
meanings.sent3: The charged particle's gyrofrequency seemed to have a mind of its own in the magnetic field.
meanings.sent4: The gyrofrequency of the electron spun like a top in the magnetic field playground.
meanings.sent5: The gyrofrequency paints a vivid picture of the charged particle's magnetic whirl.
